channel.title: C# and XNA - Path Master 3D [Newer Video]
channel.description:
[b]Note:[/b] I have changed the title from "The Block Game 3D: A Quest for 3D Knowledge" to Path Master 3D, as it is now an official game project with a real name.
The object of the game is to make all of the blue squares red by touching them, and one they become red they're no longer walkable. It was meant to look visually appealing with the simple textures and has so far found success. Hopefully I'm able to take this game far.
[b]WIP Video #1:[/b] http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=kGIjfpTkUsA
[b]WIP Video #2[/b] http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=OqKE-3ZKsP0
[b]WIP Video #3[/b] http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=SjhYqIhtY0M
[b]WIP Video #4[/b] http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=GLt2KiXjA-M
[b]WIP Video #5[/b] http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=HmUOsHVTvu0
~Lin

item.title: C# and XNA - Path Master 3D [Newer Video]
item.dc:creator: @matzie matzie
item.description:
@matzie wrote:

[quote=“Lin, post:19, topic:420684”]Actually, it fits in a lot. Your button on the other hand, doesn’t. There’s not a single gradient in the entire game and there yours is. Gradients don’t make good button images either. I might end up changing a tiny bit of it to make the gloss make more sense, but that’ll be it. Just remember all of this is customizable so if you truly hate it you can always just change it yourself. Thanks anyway.

[quote author=Davidi2 link=topic=523360.msg3816099#msg3816099 date=1321350459]
What about that other game you were making?
[/quote]On hold/abandoned due to lack of motivation and ideas for weapons, story, and an original map to build.[/quote]

GRAVEROBBER- but. I did like his opinion better because it was more block style. Your entire interface is consisting of “block” shapes and then you have the round (x) button. Really caused an eew factor for me >.>’

[quote=“Taharok, post:52, topic:420684”]Any chance on adding xbox support someday? :)[/quote]Doubtfully. I don’t own an xbox. One day, it might be available on a mobile device.

Anyway, new video! All the main stuff for the first release is done. If I get a lot of feedback on the first release, I’ll work on it more. I’d work on levels and testing tomorrow, but it’s my birthday, so I don’t exactly feel like doing work

item.title: C# and XNA - Path Master 3D [Newer Video]
item.dc:creator: @Lin Lin
item.description:
@Lin wrote:

[quote=“Davidi2, post:50, topic:420684”]Very cool!
Can I ask how many lines of code the entire thing is? Just curious :P[/quote]Thanks. Uuh, probably around 4000 lines. 3036 from about 7 or 8 major classes, and there are currently 30 classes - soon to become 32, plus the shaders. So quite a lot

EDIT: I updated the input menu to support editing the controls of the level editor. The new input system (For only the “Place [Block]” and everything after) supports using the mouse or the keyboard. Any scrolling must use the secondary key (indicated by the “S+”) because of the zooming function.

Read full topic

@mod_taharok wrote:

Lin, hit me up on msn. We’ll get through the weird opengl problems. There’s always a way! Plus, I think I misinformed you on some things regarding vertex buffer objects.

Read full topic
item.source: C# and XNA - Path Master 3D [Newer Video]

item.title: C# and XNA - Path Master 3D [Newer Video]
item.dc:creator: @Lin Lin
item.description:
@Lin wrote:

Lol, well switching to vertex buffers for regions (since there’s only 3 types of map blocks, it’s kinda pointless to make them based on block type), I managed to get a huge performance boost. Previously, ~15,000 cubes in the game dropped the performance down to about 15 FPS, while this new system allows nearly 60 FPS for 100,000 cubes with fast vertex list rebuilding (Btw I have an ATI Radeon HD 3650).

Big thanks to Taharok for helping and providing info.

EDIT: After many hours of rewriting the rendering engine, I gave up due to issues with culling and unknown graphics card limitations that made everything really hard to work with and kinda left me hanging. I went back to the old rendering engine and just worked on the level editor and other small things. I also made another WIP video:

Read full topic
item.source: C# and XNA - Path Master 3D [Newer Video]

item.source: C# and XNA - Path Master 3D [Newer Video]

item.title: C# and XNA - Path Master 3D [Newer Video]
item.dc:creator: @Lin Lin
item.description:
@Lin wrote:

Thanks for all the support guys. As soon as I finish the level editor though, rather than sticking to the game and adding things like multiplayer support, I’ll be calling it a done project and learning more to build more complex games. For example, I don’t know what half the mathematical functions in the HLSL do (mainly because I haven’t taken any calculus classes), or how to draw a multi-textured cube, or how to actually modify texture coordinates, or how to draw everything with one draw call, despite having different textures (That really impacts performance and because of it, Path Master 3D is a lot slower with big maps than it should be). Still, this was an amazing learning experience in its own right and maybe I’ll make enough money with it to buy a book that explains all I need to learn. Not saying I’ll charge for it, but I have people saying they would pay for it so maybe they’d be kind enough to donate.

EDIT: After a long time, I finally got somewhere with the level editor. Currently, you can place move around and place blocks. No changing or removing them though, although it’s just a couple of lines I have put off adding. I had to create a separate shader for the hotspot (so it appears even when not on a block, as the screenshot shows) which was a pain due to unknown alpha issues, but it’s all working now. Apart from that, I majorly increased the performance aspect and possibilities of the game, making huge maps or large structures now possible.

Read full topic

item.description:

[quote=“Lin, post:31, topic:420684”][quote author=MistaBigBoss link=topic=523360.msg3826744#msg3826744 date=1322253969]
Total Time Spent: Undefined

Could you define the above.
If possible, just curious.
[/quote]Hmm… Well, lately I’ve been slacking on progress, but overall, many hours. Keep in mind I actually started this project with almost no knowledge with how to make a 3D game.

[quote author=Morx link=topic=523360.msg3827293#msg3827293 date=1322280567]
Nice progress, can’t wait too see more.
[/quote]Me neither. I want to hurry and finish this project so I can start something else. I’m feeling strong for a 3D RPG similar to RuneScape or… Actually a RuneScape Private Server. RuneScape has been looking very fun lately and I’ve been feeling very nostalgic. Listening to “Scape Main”, the old title track, was almost orgasmic.[/quote]Do you mean a RuneScape PS in XNA or the old fashioned way?
